reviews.review_text: The first thing you notice walking in is the atmosphere. Perfectly curated to provide an authentic experience. I was staying at the Pan Pacific for a work event, and felt like getting some sushi at 9pm. If youre also having a craving, definitely check out Miku! Im a vegetarian, my server Miles made some great suggestions that perfectly suited my tastes. He even made some great adjustments to what I was thinking of getting. Finally, the tea was a delicious matcha that was exactly the right temperature. (Im a tea enthusiast!) I would rate the whole experience a 10/10 Vegetarian options: Great vegetarian and vegan options! If youre a vegetarian, try the garden roll you wont regret it!

Our server Marina was excellent. She guided our every decision and took great care of us. We shared many dishes and agreed every single bite was delicious. Worth every penny! You have to eat here at least once in your life. I already want to go back. Enjoy! Dietary restrictions: Our server made sure to ask about any allergies/restrictions. I have no doubt they would accommodate any request.

First time here, and everyone that told me to come was 1000% correct. We started with the Hokkaido Scallops, which were delicate, flavorful, and beautifully presented. I got the Miku Signature Selection and Surf & Turf Roll for dinner. I cannot recommend the Miku Signature Selection enough. It was an incredible selection of the menu, essentially a chance to try everything except the Surf & Turf roll. Everything in the Selection was delicious and novel. The Surf & Turf roll really blew me away with the addition of truffle flavor. My mouth is watering just writing this review.

By far one of the freshest fish I ve ever tasted, akin to Japan. I got different types of nigiri and it simply melted in my mouth. I didn t order a lot as I had a heavy lunch, but enough to try a variety of their fish. Green tea opera cake was also delicious - layers were the perfect consistency, level of crunch and flavours. Good atmosphere - it s light and airy inside, it has a stunning view of the mountains and ocean, and the place is buzzing. Service was professional, attentive and he gave his recommendation when I couldn t decide on two desserts. The staff at the front were polite when I arrived and left. Washrooms are pretty nice, there s dim lighting and it s relatively modern. I prefer this Miku to the one in Toronto. This one has a better location and view - it was nice to walk around Canada Place afterwards too. Overall, I d highly recommend this place!

The atmosphere is pretty nice with fantastic view! Our server was so polite he s name was Shohie if I m not mistaken. We spent around 3 hours there and tried a wide variety of food. The chef was so creative . Thanks for the nice food! Food : 5/5 |

I ve tried Miku in Toronto sometimes but Miku in Vancouver is impeccable. The Wagyu Steak was the highlight of the meal which we had to order 2 times to try because it was so good. My friends said this is the best place in Vancouver to have oysters because its sauce. Our server was friendly and dedicated. The hostesses was very nice and we always felt welcomed.

Wow... Wow... Wow... bite after bite was a sublime experience in what Japanese fine dining can be.  Miku is a five star experience that deserves your visit. The modern restaurant is beautiful, clean, and perfectly maintained.  We recommend sitting on the patio where you can either people watch or gaze over the harbour.  Inside tables offer window views or a view of the open kitchen.  Its all beautiful and adds to the experience. Service is professional, friendly, and gracious.  We followed our servers recommendations and that was the right choice.  A team of people keeps the meal moving along and provides explanations of what you are eating. However, the food is the star here and that is how it should be.  The flavors are carefully paired here and you will want to give those flavors a chance to delight your palette.  This is NOT sushi to be dunked in soya sauce.  I think you will also be delighted by how their cocktails complement the food choices. Put Miku on your special meal out list and make an evening of it.  This is one of Vancouvers dining gems and certainly the best Japanese cuisine I have eaten.  I think you will agree.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi there! Thank you so much for the kind words! We really appreciate it and are beyond happy that you enjoyed your experience at Miku so much. Were looking forward to serving you again soon

reviews.review_text: Wow!! What an amazing experience! Delicious drinks with amazing twist & and the most delicious sushi I ve had so far (and I ve had many!!) Great location, great view and most importantly great service, polite, quick, and so informative! Very professional. Would definitely come back again. Food

What a great location to eat at. The depths of flavours attained here are quite spectacular. I had the Waterfront 6 course set, and wow....just lovely and quite filling. Their creative approach to plating/presenting each dish and customer service really stuck out. Honestly no complaints. The only suggestion I would have is to coordinate the waiter with chefs/cooks when plating the food at the table. The chefs/cooks struggled a bit explaining the concept to each dish and how to best approach it, as well as answering questions...the waiter overheard once and had to step in to correct the original statement on how to best consume the dish; I am assuming the waiter just has a better depth of knowledge and skillset to verbally sell/market each dish given their position and inherent responsibilities...This is me being overly nit picky though and should not deter anyone from visiting. 100% worth the trip. Overall, for anyone who loves japanese food, this place is worth the time and money. To note, the location is quite busy, so book ahead of time.

Service here was A1! Continually being checked on by several different staff. Quick, fresh food provided by an open kitchen. Im not a big sushi fan, but was with my group and they all loved what they ordered. I had an IPA and ate some snap peas and brussel sprouts. I would recommend

We made a quick stop in Miku and were happy they could accommodate us without a reservation. We ordered edamame, Ebi Fritters, Garden Roll, Oshi Sampler. The pickled Zucchini on the garden roll provided nice flavor to what can other be bland veggie rolls - I would absolutely order them again! The Prawns were also worthy of a repeat. Service was great. Overall nice portions and very affordable.

We absolutely love this restaurant. Food are so fresh and delicious! Drink are amazing! But the best are the staff!  Especially Graeme and Henry, these two are exceptionally wonderful, friendly and competent and knowledgeable!  Do yourself a favour and choose to sit by the bar area!!!   Please recognize and acknowledge these two!  They definitely are 5 stars quality employees!!!

Miku Vancouver is beautiful inside out. The views from the patio are incredible and the food from the appetizer to the dessert was simply amazing. Though the price point is a little high, I could easily say that it was one of the best sushi I ve ever had, and that it was worth it. I would highly recommend it visiting here at least once, especially if you do not live in Vancouver.

Exquisite quality of fish. For sushi, order the Oshi sampler so you find your favorite rolls to order more. The service and views are amazing. My favourite part is that we were given blankets when it got chilly on the patio.

I love dining at Miku. The food is always amazingly delicious and the restaurant is always busy. It s advisable to make reservations ahead of time. I love their beef carpaccio, spicy soba noodles and their classic green tea opera cake!

I tired 2 Kaiseki dinner sets that night to celebrate my husband s birthday. Everything is wonderful especially Chef s selection fresh & best of the best Staffs are really knowledgeable about the Kaiseki that they introduced each course to us patiently, particularly each sushi & sashimi. Well done

Food was exquisite, creative and delicious.  They let their ingredients speak for themselves and do not obscure their natural flavours too much.  Portions were quite adequate for the Miku Kaiseki, even considering I didnt eat anything the whole day. Service from the main server was quite good, but the commentary from the runners when they bring out the food was almost inaudible.  The environment was too loud and they spoke way too softly.  Also had the same runner ask me a couple of times if I ordered the Kaiseki so that he could clear my chopsticks, soy sauce or other unneeded utensils. Bit of a hiccup with the last dish of nigiri.  Waited for quite some time after the previous dish.  The whole dinner affair took around 2h15m which was a bit long. The view of the water was a little disappointing as the restaurant overlooks a freight shipping dock.  It was a little chilly too as the door to the patio was left open.  With the aforementioned noise, cant really rate the atmosphere very high. Still, I very much enjoyed the experience and despite the criticisms would rate it 5-stars.

It is the most elegant sushi I had. The fish melts in your mouth! What an amazing culinary experience! The service was friendly and the Sake recommandation was spot on  not cheap, but since the meal was so refined it called for a lush and polished taste. Food

Got the Miku 7-course Kaiseki, flavors were very creative and bold - with a mix of heavier rich features (like the apple-glazed scallop) balanced by super fresh sashimi (best I have ever had). You definitely need to have an appreciation for seafood and an open-mindedness for some creative flavors (sweet/bitter/savoury) for the set to be worth the $185 price tag. Overall, great service and amazing food - reserve ahead!
I came here with my parents. Had an amazing experience. Steak and sushi were so good!!! Desert was delicious. Recommend the green tea opera desert!!    Servers were so nice as well. 5 star worthy!!!

So glad we came here! I was having a rough week, but the kindness from our server Charlotte was AMAZING! We had such a great experience here and ordered the Kaiseki which was phenomenal. We couldn t decide what to eat so the kaiseki was a great option to try a little bit of everything! I forgot to take a picture of the sashimi and dessert, but it was such a fun dining experience. Definitely will be back!! Thank you Charlotte& Miku!

Overall very nice! I really appreciate the ambiance and attention to detail with the decorations. The restaurant looks over the 5 sails and the water which is super beautiful. Our waiter was good however our group felt rushed. We started with the calamari which was very crispy and had a nice soy side sauce. We then each got the smoky sushi combo (or something along those lines) and it had a variety of different nigiri, rolls, etc. The fish was super fresh and definitely packed a lot of flavor. Overall would recommend for a nice dinner.
Food, view, service were awesome! We had lunch to celebrate my partner s birthday and we had an amazing time. Claudia was very nice. We will be back with the whole fam!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Kim! Thank you for your review. Were so happy to have been part of this special occasion and we look forward to serving you again in the future along with your whole family! Thank you for the lovely photos as well.

reviews.review_text: This was our second time dining at Miku and it was every bit as good as the first. The staff was helpful and attentive.  The atmosphere is fresh and on the hip side and bustling, which usually is a good sign.  The real star is the inventive cuisine. We started with a Wagu carpaccio with an egg yolk emulation and different sauces on top. It was expensive, different, and tasty. The Brussels Chips were well seasoned although a little soft for me. Aburri style sushi is synonymous with Miau which takes super fresh fish and applies a torched sear and a light seasoning. All of my offerings were outstanding.  We spent$100 pp but it was a special evening.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Alex, thank you for your kind review and for coming back to dine with us! We really appreciate it

reviews.review_text: Absolutely delicious and the quality is great as well. Every dish that we ordered was divine, especially the scallops. Honestly one of the best places I ve ever had scallops. My only complaint would be that the brussel sprouts were either too salty or not seasoned enough, but it was cooked very well. The sablefish was amazing and I wouldn t have expected anything less for that classic dish at a restaurant of this calibre. Overall, I would definitely come back.

Although on the higher price range, food was good with an artistic presentation. Nice location with water front views of downtown Vancouver. Made reso a few weeks ahead and everything requested was bang on.
Excellent sushi, sashimi, ngiri and other goodies. Wonderful fresh flavor. Top notch. If you are visiting Vancouver stop by. We loved it.

We came here for our honeymoon and ordered the 7 course chefs menu. Our expectations were quite high already because Miku was highly recommended, but they still managed to blow us away with both the food and the service. Our server, Seung, was fantastic. She made our meal so memorable but all the staff were fantastic. Each course was timed perfectly and tasted amazing, especially the surf and turf and nigiri courses. Very thoughtful and delicious, worth every penny.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Kevin, thank you for the kind words! Were beyond happy to have made your honeymoon extra special with this experience. Wed love to serve you again in the future and will pass on your compliments to the team!

reviews.review_text: Our server was lovely and attentive. We got the kaiseki set menus and they were delicious! The earl grey dessert was amazing as was the filet mignon.

We loved excellent food and service! We just walked in and immediately got a table for two. The reservation in advance was not possible, but try just to walk in. We had a 6 course menu and it was delicious!

So yummy! Came here with a friend because we were craving salmon aburi oshi. I tried the surf & turf roll to treat myself, as I normally wouldn t spend $24 on a sushi roll, and it did not disappoint! The lobster on top was so flavourful. We couldn t make a reservation, but we were seated right away at the bar.
Booking is required. Sashimi is quite fresh. Fish has been delivered in the morning. Sushi and steak are also delicious.

Graeme and Henry made our experience here so amazing, their customer service is outstanding. They are both so passionate, kind, welcoming, and create a classy ambience. The food was extraordinary but the service was out of this world. 10 stars if we could!!! We come back to Vancouver to see them every time.

I couldn t book a table but walked in and they were able to accommodate. First time coming here and service was fast and friendly, sat out in patio and food didn t take long to at all. Everything I ordered was delicious, will come back again!

I will forever remember this experience. The food is phenomenal. We came here for our 10 year anniversary and ordered the Waterfront 6 course meal. I definitely recommend experiencing the 6 course or 8 course meal. It s pricey but you will not regret it. Take that from someone who never eats raw and uncooked seafood but devoured every dish that came to our table. Some of the dishes offered in the 6 course and 8 course meal are not on their regular menu. We sat at a table overlooking the waterfront. It was romantic and beautiful. The service and food make the price well worth it. You got to try it once in your life.

The food was phenomenal! If you look at the portions you get and make a quick judgement, you ll regret it. I got the traditional sushi and thought it wasn t much but I actually felt stuffed. It was my brothers wedding so they gave us caviar and a dessert plate. The customer service was excellent too, never had to wait for the servers and the orders arrived at a timely manner. Definitely want to try out more dishes the next time I have a meal there.

Looking for lunch on a cold and windy day, my wife and I read sign from across street as Mike. Not knowing or expecting anything, we discovered it was Miku, Michelin starred restaurant. We were dressed in tourist-walking around clothes, but had a great lunch. Presentation, Food, and Service were great.

We had the Miku Kaiseki 7 course tasting menu, every dish was absolutely delicious and the cocktails were great too. Definitely on the pricier side of things, but you get what you pay for, it was amazing. Great service too.
Delicious sushi and a nice atmosphere right along the waterfront. We came after the Flyover Canada show and it was a perfect compliment with great views and service

If someone wants to be in Coal Harbour for a quality sushi experience, especially if they are from out of town, this is the place I would take them. It s a premium experience, but if you have the funds, it s money well spent on quality seafood. All-time faves include aburi salmon oshi, aburi ebi, champagne roll, o-/chu-toro nigiri, and green tea opera cake. Hard to go wrong, though. Bonus: stunning views of Canada Place and great for cruise ship watching.
This restaurant is so fancy, food are spectacular. Sushi and sashimi are so fresh but it s a bit pricy. Great view and suitable for special occasions.

If this is your first time visiting Vancouver, Miku would be my top recommendations on your itinerary list for places to eat. Now, this isnt your typical sushi restaurant, in fact, I would consider this to be fine dining and heres why. When it comes to Japanese food, presentation is the most important next to customer service level, and they are bang on. I absolutely love how intricate their sushi  layered to simplicity on a plate. Reminds me of a zen garden. The waiters/ waitress are knowledgeable of their dishes being served and super friendly! Dishes are, at minimum $20, but the portions are decently sized. (Anything with Wagyu will always be expensive). They do offer gluten -free and vegetarian dishes and non alcoholic drinks. (I had their Shiso Nojito and it was the most refreshing non-alcoholic Ive ever had. Not too sweet either). Overall, I would highly recommend it for first time travellers to Vancouver. Its absolutely a beautiful place to dine in! Dietary restrictions: Gluten-free available

We had the 7 course Kaiseki dinner and were very impressed by the taste of most of the dishes. Also, the portion is very large and we found it quite heavy. Favourites are the insanely tender fillet, the Hokkaido scallop, oyster, and fresh sashimi. Few of the menu items were a miss, such as the Uni (Sea urchin) which we found not fresh at all. And sake pairing was late for one of the courses. Overall, this was a delicious meal and definitely recommended. We would have liked some lighter dishes that were not fatty-protein-focused, or slightly less portion for lower price (like the omakase platter at the end). Bring a large appetite if you are ordering this tasting menu!
Food was delicious! We ordered many different dishes for our table and shared everything. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu.

Amazing sushi! I was able to secure a spot at the bar as a solo walk-in shortly after they opened for lunch. The lobster ceviche was light, bright, and fresh. The assortment of sushi on the premium sushi lunch platter hit the spot. The quality of their ingredients and composition of flavors are worth the trip in.
We have Signature Shokai and Traditional Sushi Set.  Absolutely delicious.  Staff is very friendly.  Will come back again.
The food was delicious and the service was amazing. The waitress was very kind and we got our food quickly. We ordered Sablefish, chicken katsu and manhattan strip

Although there was a wait for a table, they text when a table is available, so I was able to go for a walk while waiting. From the moment I walked in, the service was fantastic. I sat at the bar and it was a great atmosphere with phenomenal service. Paul was a great bartender and server and gave really good recommendations on what to order. My water glass was never empty, which is always a bonus. The food was phenomenal - really flavourful and perfectly prepared. It is the type of food where you want to savour every bite. A great sushi restaurant that I will definitely visit again.

This was my kids first sushi experience and they loved it! The atmosphere is awesome, the staff was super friendly and accommodating for my young kids, and the sushi was outstanding! I highly recommend the Salmon Oshi Sushi, its a winner for everyone!

While passing the Vancouver, I tried Miku for lunch. I ordered the Premium Sushi platter (pre-seasoned), including miso. Absolutely delicious! Service was prompt and friendly. The view of the harbour was beautiful.

Miku is a fantastic restaurant. I enjoyed the lobster ceviche, peperoncino (non-spicy), sablefish (one of my favorites) and miku and surf and turf roll. The menu is diverse and the food is amazing. I would return!

Extremely great & fresh sushi! We went for lunch, got the Aburi 3 course meal, it comes with 10 pieces sushi + 2 appetizer + 1 soup for $45 + 1 dessert add on $8 Our server Claudia was amazing, very willing share more info about the sushi courses
Truly a Michelin star restaurant with good presentations, view and delicious sushi and soba. Perfect for a date or romantic birthday dinner
I loved this place! Sushi was so fresh and flavourful. Our waiter was so kind and informative, he really knew the menu and provided great recommendations. Worth every penny!

Have dined here twice. Once in September and once two weeks ago. The food is fantastic and the price is not that bad. The staff are super good! They are not only serve well but know how to talk. The staff came to my table to compliment my date in a very smart way. Many restaurants s service has been decreased this year but this restaurant stay resilient. The only advice is that the music is kind of loud during dinner when I dinned in two weeks ago.

This is the place to go to if you want a view of the water, fresh seafood, and the best aburi oshi sushi you can get in Vancouver. It can get pricey, so keep that in mind. This is a good place for a celebration, company event, special occasion, etc, or if you re in the mood for some aburi oshi sushi. The location is close to waterfront, and if you get a seat with a view, it s perfect to just stare out at the water while enjoying a delicious meal. Everything is so well prepared and fresh. Service is top notch, warm, and welcoming. Check out the menu before you come here as it s not for everyone, but lovers of sushi and a fine dining experience will enjoy what Miku has to offer.
The sushi quality and service were first rate. Are the non-sushi/sashimi items were limited both persons in the party who got the steak raved about it and the accompanying potatoes.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Dean, thank you for your review! Were glad that you and your group were able to enjoy our menu selection. Hope to see you again in the future!

reviews.review_text: This restaurant was a fantastic experience. The food was delicious and had surprisingly large portions. Our server was professional and attentive. My ribeye steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and the sablefish was also delicious. The surf and turf role was excellent and I would order it again. The view was also lovely during dinner.
Phenomenal sushi. Everything was absolutely amazing from miso soup to sushi, beef, and salad. Outstanding location and perfect service.

Impressive sushi. Highly recommend to reserve before coming. The sushi was so delicious. Feels like almost every server is from Japan. Dessert was fascinating as well. Recommend white chocolate cheese cake and strawberry mousse.
So delicious. The fresh sashimi was out of this world. Amazing Toro. DO NOT skip dessert. Sat by the window with a water view. Worth the $100 per person price tag.

Usually when dine in Miku I would just sit wherever available, but this time I waited for a balcony seat. It is the smallest table and it s at the corner. That spot is freaking cold even with the blanket and heater on. Food and service is great as usual, just want to give people a heads up - bring an extra layer of you want to seat outside.
Excellent sushi chic place for lunch /dinner expensive but worth the price. Reservation is a must as very popular, patio is so beautiful in sunny day

Be prepared to remortgage your house after dining here. It s pretty pricy. BUT I ll tell you this, I will literally DRIVE MY FAMILY into bankruptcy and homelessness if it means dining here again. The sushi is to DIE FOR!!!! And I ve been to some luxury sushi restaurants in the states. But Miku stands out!!! Every bite gets better. I ate so much I needed a wheelchair to get myself out of the restaurant. I don t regret a single bite. Eat here if you re in Vancouver!!!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Were exceptionally thrilled that you enjoyed your dining experience with us, Razan! Thank you for such an enthusiastic review!

reviews.review_text: Best food Ive had all year. Staff were friendly and helped me choose some great dishes. View was amazing!!! I had the soft shell crab appetizer, sashimi lunch, and their pressed sushi which had a great charred flavour while still being light and fresh.

Came here for Saturday lunch. The lunch menu is very good quality for value, especially the lunch shokai. Sushi & sashimi are fresh & excellent quality as Miku is reputed for. Service was also very good. Definitely make a booking on the weekend as the restaurant filled up very quickly when opened & had a constant stream of people coming & going.
6/5 stars. Nothing less than expected. Amazing food, outstanding service, exceptional experience.

Miku Vancouver is an absolute gem for sushi enthusiasts seeking a delightful dining experience. One of the highlights of Miku Vancouver is the breathtaking view it offers if you manage to secure a table near the window. When it comes to sushi recommendations, the Salmon Oshi and Ebi Oshi sushi stand out as my personal favorites. It is highly recommended making a reservation at least a week ahead of time, or even a few weeks if its a weekend or during peak hours.

Is it pretentious? Probably, but the quality/freshness of food was great and the sauces are well done. Service is top notch; servers seemingly care about your experience and are quite personable. Great atmosphere, awesome views. Its by the convention center so parking is at a premium.
Great service with the most delicious food! Definitely recommend the ebi fritters, tofu salad, and salmon oshi.
Food was excellent! Service was superb! Recommend the lamb chops, waterfront platter and risotto. Scallops, soba, Oshi sampler were great too. Too bad the Surf and Turf roll was not available.

We visited on a Saturday night and had a fantastic experience! Our server, Ferris, looked after us so well with the perfect level of attention and excellent suggestions on what to order since it was our first visit. Really, everything we ordered was delicious but the standouts were the BC spot prawn, otoro and the oshi sushi. We look forward to returning!

I would say that s the top level sushi bar in Vancouver, second time to check that place and still really enjoyed. Service is really friendly I would like to offer 15% tips with my bill. Wagyu sushi still the best I recommend and their oyster taste really fresh. Also you can enjoy the view for Vancouver river while you having those top level cuisines. Will be there every time I travel to Vancouver

Incredible food, it was an experience as well as the best meal Ive ever had. The set menu might have small portions but each bite is perfection and the amount of food you get overall was perfect - not too full but very satisfied, and the presentation was perfection. The wait staff was excellent, as well, always there when you needed them but they gave my partner and I space to enjoy our evening without being rushed. Overall couldnt recommend more if you can squeeze it into your budget!

Really nice sushi spot on the waterfront. If you sit at the bar you have a good view of the sushi prep. The chefs choice platter was a really nice way to try it out as a first-timer. Close to transit. Will definitely go back.

One of many great sushi restaurants around. The staff were friendly and attentive to our group and so was our waiter. Definitely enjoyed the quality of the sushi made by skilled chefs. We ve ordered some items and apologies for not including photos of some rolls and nigiri, because of hunger.

Fantastic food, great views and the service was great! The all took time to chat and guide through the menu. The servers and workers create a fun environment. They are super quick and super friendly. Overall, amazing! highly recommend. Must A try! Food

An amazing dining experience in downtown Vancouver with some of the best sushi Ive ever eaten. Gorgeous views of Vancouver harbor, beautifully decorated interior and comfortable seating. Service was fast and friendly. The food was incredible. I had the pressed salmon rolls theyre known for and they did not disappoint. All of the fish was extremely fresh and prepared well. Perfect dining experience and I will definitely return!

My wife and I are visiting from Boston. We ate here last Friday during lunch. We decided to come here based on their stellar reviews and it did not disappoint. We had 2 servers, they were both attentive, friendly, and took good care of us. I appreciated the female server for recommending the Green Tea Opera dessert. I can see why it takes them 3 days to make this dessert as it was absolutely delicious. Can t rush perfection! The hazelnut wafer crunch in my opinion does an amazing job blending the amazing ice cream and green tea cake. We were given complimentary scallops. It was SO fresh and sweet. A great way to open our appetite. The Oysters we ordered was really tasty. In my opinion you didn t need the lemon or soy sauce that comes with it, because it was sweet by itself. I ordered the premium from the lunch menu and my wife ordered 2 specialty rolls. The premium was a great value as you got 12 excellent variety of sushi. What I loved about it was that you didn t need to eat it with any soy sauce as the fish was really fresh and high quality. Also the portions was very fair. We were stuffed by the end of our meal. Highly recommend coming here during lunch if you want to experience something amazing at a reasonable price.

First time in Vancouver and first place I went to is this place! Did not disappoint. Was so good and we had the best waitress. Views are great. Rolls are tasty and drinks are very nice. Highly recommend

If youre reading this youre probably looking for the best sushi in Vancouver and Miku wont disappoint. Great downtown location close to lots of parking, beautiful view of the coast and sushi and seafood thats incredible to be getting on this side of the Pacific. Fish is flown in daily and we were lucky enough to be able to order the otoro sashimi - it was so good that a second order was placed. Dont hesitate to come here.

Celebrated our anniversary here with the 180 Miku Kaiseki menu. Everything was beautifully prepared and extremely fresh. The tasting is pricey, but if you want to get a feel for the entire menu it s a wonderful experience.

Beautiful views, excellent service, delicious and fresh and stunning presentation. Miku is popular and for good reason. Highly recommend the king salmon nigiri, Sashimi Platter and Miku Signature Selection.

I ordered Green tea, Jasmin tea, rice bowl, steamed edamame, vegetable tempura garden roll, vegetable platter and the Green Tea Opera. This was good amount of food for two and gave a good cross section of their vegetarian offerings. Thank you for placing goodness and passion in you food And hospitality. We truly appreciated the flavours, the twists and surprises, the artistic expression of Miku.

Came on New Years Eve and got their holiday kaiseki. Although VERY expensive, I thought it was worth it for the holidays! I love trying tasting menus and Miku did not disappoint. Every dish was delicious and fresh and service was amazing.
People go here for the pressed sushi, which is pretty awesome, but their protein selection is pretty impressive to.  Try the lamb, try the prime rib.
Great experience. Loved their sockeye Oshi sushi
First time at Miku and it did not disappoint. Miku Kaiseki is a must and so are the aburis.

Great sushi, especially their Aburi is the best in town! Had seasonal special kaiseki for spring. So happy they are incorporating Iwate wagyu beef into their menu. We had the beef at Aburi store in West Van and were very impressed how juicy and tasty they were.
Tasty sushi and cocktails. Very fresh. Definitely worth trying.

Been here three times and it was consistently great. First of all, service and environment was excellent as always. Great view as well if sitting outside. For specific dishes: Coal Harbor Platter: 5/5. Great sampler of seafood. Scallop tasted great despite being a bit small. Salmon sashimi was with little flavor. Overall it was still great and highly recommended. Lunch Shokai: 4.5/5. Came with two small appetizers, both tasted good. Most of the 10 pieces of sushi were good, except that the green vegetable one and ebi (would be great if it s amaebi). Sushi rice was a bit cold probably because we sat outside and waited a bit too long to consume.

Elevated sushi experience! Visited for my birthday at lunch time, was super lucky to even get an available spot(Ive been checking way in advance and they were pretty booked up). Great quality sushi, we had the salmon oshi roll along with assorted nigiri and the tartare which was my absolute favorite! Service was excellent and atmosphere was nice too. Loved it, will definitely return and recommend!

This place is incredible. Beautiful view of the harbour, the sushi flavours were complex and perfectly balanced but all unique (we had the premium lunch platter). And of course the opera green tea cake is a must (it takes 3 days to make!) Dont miss this place, the highlight of my trip for sure!

Fantastic food, great views and good service! This is arguably the best Japanese food I ve ever had. The miso soup and the appetizers were amazing  flavorful, shrimp was cooked perfectly and breading was light and crisp. The sushi is even better  everything was perfectly balanced. All the tastes were spot-on, textures were on-point and everything was just perfect! The sea urchin was a huge hit for us. The  Premium  menu option was also one of our favorites. The views are also amazing  seaplane, ocean, boats and mountains. What more could you ask for?? Finally, the service was great! The all took time to chat and guide us through the menu. The servers and workers create a fun environment. They are super quick and super friendly. Overall, amazing! Great restaurant, and highly recommend.

Amazing sushi, great ambience, and great view of the harbor and mountains right from your table. Unfortunately a 2hr seating limit that is enforced. My group was told to leave when we hit that 2hr mark

The aburi oshi (aka torched and pressed sushi) is what theyre known for. If you dont know which one to get, they do have an oshi sampler which is a great way to go. Drink-wise, I only tried the bergamot sour, which was delicious and had a nice light sweet/spice to it. Also, I had Paul as my bartender/server at the bar seating area and he was sooo friendly and fantastic.
At Miko restaurant, youll find top-tier sushi. Its fresh, skillfully made, and beautifully presented. A must-try for sushi lovers! Sooo yummyy!!!!!

Amazing! Make a reservation before! If you don t - put your name down for  walk in  and then go grab drinks before hand while waiting - the wait is 100% worth it! This restaurant takes sushi and service to another level! Our waitress folded our napkins while we were away and topped off our wine glasses and was super friendly! We shared everything and every item we ordered was 10/10 amazing! Best sushi I ve ever had and the freshest seafood!

Really great quality of food! It is a bit expensive but definetely worth it if you like authentic modern Japanese food. The matcha dessert was delicious. I really enjoyed the hot entrees as I dont love raw sushi. However the people in my group that like raw sushi said it was spectacular!

A truly outstanding food experience!  Had the 7-course Miku Kaiseki and it was certainly worth it - every bite was truly a delight.  I was not totally versed in Japanese cuisine and the menu stretched my comfort levels at times BUT I experienced flavours and textures I shall never forget.  This is sure to be one of the most memorable dining experiences of a lifetime.
